alert.note: Alert for Crockett (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 8:02PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CROCKETT COUNTY THROUGH 900 PM CST... At 801 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over I-10 Near The Crockett-Pecos County Line, or near Sheffield, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Ozona, The Intersection Of Us 190 And Highway 163, Ft Lancaster, The Intersection Of I-10 And Highway 405, and The Intersection Of I-10 And Highway 290. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 328 and 379. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CST for west central Texas.
